title.narrative: Support to the Nexus Initiative phase II 2022-2024

description.narrative:
The Nexus Initiative: Global Advocacy for Sexual and Reproductive Health and Rights (SRHR)
Overall objective of the Initiative is to equip its members to better push back against the pushback on SRHR in UN negotiations, thereby safeguarding the implementation of SRHR programmes and policies on the ground and helping to ensure women’s and girls’ SRHR which is essential for developing countries’ achievement of sustainable development.

organisation.narrative: Permanent Mission of Denmark to the United Nations, New York, USA

mailing-address.narrative: Chrysler East Building, 666 Third Avenue, 11th Floor

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

title.narrative: Facilitate political coordination and alliance building on SRHR issues in intergovernmental negotiations

Output Indicator 3a: Working partnerships and coordination with like-minded governments are established and outreach conducted with middle-ground countries, in Geneva, New York and at capital level through diplomatic networks and ministerial outreach to broaden support to gender equality and SRHR in UN fora and related negotiations
Output Indicator 3b: Working relations and partnerships are maintained with key influential stakeholders and networks, including relevant UN entities and civil society actors to focus the narrative, enhance coordinated messaging and advocacy efforts, and impact on negotiations to uphold SRHR and gender equality

target.value: - Develop and maintain partnerships with multiple stakeholders, networks, and initiatives. The Nexus Secretariat will work and regularly exchange with these stakeholders, collecting and sharing intelligence on SRHR-related processes. - Organize meetings and dialogues among high-level government officials, including with influential government representatives from countries that are not yet vocal but are supportive of SRHR at international negotiations but are implementing SRHR at the national level - Intensify on-going mobilization and strategic outreach to middle-ground countries in capital, New York and Geneva - Regular middle-ground country mapping and analysis is provided to Nexus members - Increased number of delegations support joint statements, are more vocal and supportive of SRHR in negotiations.

- Develop and maintain partnerships with multiple stakeholders, networks, and initiatives. The Nexus Secretariat will work and regularly exchange with these stakeholders, collecting and sharing intelligence on SRHR-related processes. - Organize meetings and dialogues among high-level government officials, including with influential government representatives from countries that are not yet vocal but are supportive of SRHR at international negotiations but are implementing SRHR at the national level - Intensify on-going mobilization and strategic outreach to middle-ground countries in capital, New York and Geneva - Regular middle-ground country mapping and analysis is provided to Nexus members - Increased number of delegations support joint statements, are more vocal and supportive of SRHR in negotiations.

- Develop and maintain partnerships with multiple stakeholders, networks, and initiatives. The Nexus Secretariat will work and regularly exchange with these stakeholders, collecting and sharing intelligence on SRHR-related processes. - Organize meetings and dialogues among high-level government officials, including with influential government representatives from countries that are not yet vocal but are supportive of SRHR at international negotiations but are implementing SRHR at the national level - Intensify on-going mobilization and strategic outreach to middle-ground countries in capital, New York and Geneva - Regular middle-ground country mapping and analysis is provided to Nexus members - Increased number of delegations support joint statements, are more vocal and supportive of SRHR in negotiations.

title.narrative: Maximize advocacy efforts and leading on a consistent narrative on gender equality and SRHR at the United Nations

Strategic and evidence-based advocacy analysis and products are developed to support cohesion and coordinated advocacy and negotiation efforts by Nexus members for high-level impact to uphold commitments to gender equality and SRHR as part of the ICPD and 2030 Agenda follow-up processes.

target.value: - Provide strategic and evidence-based advocacy analysis, elements and substantive areas of focus for advocacy efforts, through Nexus delegations, joint statements and side events - Process analysis and mapping of relevant frameworks and actions. This will enable Nexus members to aware of, prepared and equipped for current and upcoming relevant processes and developments; make tailor-made interventions at critical political negotiations/fora and use entry points/existing opportunities and spaces for discussions on critical SRHR issues. - Develop coordinate and joint strategic approaches for different UN negotiations in New York and Geneva, including at regional levels if appropriate and needed.

- Provide strategic and evidence-based advocacy analysis, elements and substantive areas of focus for advocacy efforts, through Nexus delegations, joint statements and side events - Process analysis and mapping of relevant frameworks and actions. This will enable Nexus members to aware of, prepared and equipped for current and upcoming relevant processes and developments; make tailor-made interventions at critical political negotiations/fora and use entry points/existing opportunities and spaces for discussions on critical SRHR issues. - Develop coordinate and joint strategic approaches for different UN negotiations in New York and Geneva, including at regional levels if appropriate and needed.

- Provide strategic and evidence-based advocacy analysis, elements and substantive areas of focus for advocacy efforts, through Nexus delegations, joint statements and side events - Process analysis and mapping of relevant frameworks and actions. This will enable Nexus members to aware of, prepared and equipped for current and upcoming relevant processes and developments; make tailor-made interventions at critical political negotiations/fora and use entry points/existing opportunities and spaces for discussions on critical SRHR issues. - Develop coordinate and joint strategic approaches for different UN negotiations in New York and Geneva, including at regional levels if appropriate and needed.

title.narrative: Increase political support for gender equality/SRHR agenda in multilateral frameworks

Output Indicator 1a: A technical secretariat is operational and effective.
Output Indicator 1b: A solid and flexible group of cross-regional government officials work cohesively, closely and jointly together for coordinated high-profile advocacy and outreach to mobilize broad political support to protect and advance commitments to gender equality/SRHR as part of the ICPD and 2030 Agenda follow-up processes at the United Nations

target.value: - Strategy reflection and ownership by Nexus members is enhanced through the set-up of Nexus working groups, including on SRHR language. - Reach out to government officials, through various initiatives, including joint statements, targeted outreach in New York and Geneva, as well as capital level, including ministerial engagement by Nexus ministers, including SheDecides minister champions, to mobilize like-minded ministers to encourage their delegations to be more vocal on gender equality and SRHR at UN negotiations, and ministers from middle-ground countries to ensure their positions in international negotiations reflect policies and programmes they implement at the national level, with a view to ensure broader cross-regional support for gender equality and SRHR. - Strategic Nexus meetings organized to enhance coordination and joint actions - SRHR language and negotiation strategy with roadmap defined.

- Strategy reflection and ownership by Nexus members is enhanced through the set-up of Nexus working groups, including on SRHR language. - Reach out to government officials, through various initiatives, including joint statements, targeted outreach in New York and Geneva, as well as capital level, including ministerial engagement by Nexus ministers, including SheDecides minister champions, to mobilize like-minded ministers to encourage their delegations to be more vocal on gender equality and SRHR at UN negotiations, and ministers from middle-ground countries to ensure their positions in international negotiations reflect policies and programmes they implement at the national level, with a view to ensure broader cross-regional support for gender equality and SRHR. - Strategic Nexus meetings organized to enhance coordination and joint actions - SRHR language and negotiation strategy with roadmap defined.
